Instruction: Saute the onions in a skillet with 1 1/2 teaspoons of olive oil over medium heat until they become soft and see-through.

Process the chickpeas, faux sour cream, cornmeal, garlic, cumin, coriander, salt, and hot sauce in a food processor until achieving a smooth texture. Move this mixture to a bowl, mix in the cooked onions, then cover and refrigerate for half an hour.
Use the shallow dish to hold 1/4 cup of cornmeal. Shape the dough made of garbanzo beans into six 1/2-inch thick patties and roll these patties in the cornmeal.
Use 2 tablespoons of olive oil to heat up a large skillet over medium heat. Cook the falafel cakes until they are browned on both sides, which should take approximately 5 minutes per side.
